English: Was that the last one? That was too easy.
Chinese:
打倒剛剛的對手就結束了嗎？
好無聊喔～
Korean:
어라, 지금 상대가 마지막이야?
재미없어~
German: War das der Letzte? Das war zu einfach.

English:
Hey Agumon, remember that thing? Why don't we ask
[p] about it?
Chinese:
亞古獸，
之前的那個，找[p]討論看看吧。
Korean:
저기저기, 아구몬.
저번에 그거, [p]랑 상담해보자
German:
Hey, Agumon, erinnerst du dich an diese Sache?
Warum fragen wir nicht [p] deswegen?

English: Oh yeah! Listen up, [p]!
Chinese: 啊，對了！　聽我說喔[p]！
Korean: 아, 그랬지! 들어봐, [p]!
German: Ach, stimmt! Hör zu, [p]!

English:
We want to give Nokia a present to thank her for
being so nice to us!
Chinese:
我們兩個，下次想要送禮物
給一直很照顧我們的諾奇雅！
Korean:
우리, 이번에 신세 지고 있는 노키아한테
선물 주려고 그러거든!
German:
Wir wollen Nokia etwas schenken, um ihr dafür zu
danken, dass sie so nett zu uns ist!

English:
But we don't know about human presents, so wanted
to ask you.
Chinese:
但是呀，不知道可以送什麼給人類當禮物。
所以才想來聽聽看你的意見
Korean:
그런데 말야, 인간한테 주는 선물에 대해 잘 모르니까
너랑 상의하고 싶어
German:
Aber wir wissen nicht, was man Menschen schenken
kann, also wollten wir dich fragen.

English:
What would she like? As long as it's something we
can give her.
Chinese:
要送什麼她才會開心呢？
如果是我們有辦法能送的禮物就好了……
Korean:
저기, 어떤 걸 줘야 기뻐해줄까?
우리가 선물할 수 있을 법한 거라면 좋겠는데……
German:
Was würde ihr gefallen? Es muss nur etwas sein,
was wir ihr geben können.

English:
If you don't know what she'd like, just tell us
what you'd like.
Chinese:
那個，要是覺得很難想到諾奇雅會喜歡的東西，
那就想想看你收到會覺得開心的東西。
Korean:
그러니까, 노키아가 좋아할 만한 게 어렵다면
네가 받으면 기쁜 걸 생각해줬으면 좋겠어
German:
Wenn du nicht weißt, was ihr gefällt, dann sag
uns einfach, was du gern hättest.

English:
How about a back massage?
It has to be money!
How about a practical accessory, like a watch?
Chinese:
槌肩膀票券？
當然是……錢啊！
實用的時鐘或是飾品之類的？
Korean:
어깨 안마권 같은 거?
툭 까놓고 말하자면……돈이겠지!
실용적인 시계나 액세서리 같은 거?
German:
Wie wär’s mit einer Rückenmassage?
Geld natürlich!
Ein praktisches Accessoire wie eine Uhr?

English: I see. Would you like someone to give you that?
Chinese:
原來如此～……嗯，奇怪？
收到那個會開心嗎？
Korean:
그렇구나……아니, 어라?
그거 받으면 기뻐?
German: Verstehe. Würdest du gern eine bekommen?

English:
Agumon, remember when we offered Nokia a massage
and she declined forcefully?
Chinese:
亞古獸，之前有對諾奇雅說過
「我幫妳槌肩膀唷──」，
結果被馬上拒絕的事情吧？
Korean:
아구몬, 전에 노키아한테 「어깨 안마해줄게~」라고
그랬더니 엄청난 기세로 거절당한 적 있었지?
German:
Agumon, erinnerst du dich, als wir Nokia eine
Massage angeboten haben und sie vehement abgelehnt
hat?

English: Right, we'll try it on you. Tell us how it feels.
Chinese:
好，那就先讓你來試試看
會不會很舒服吧！
Korean:
좋아~ 그럼 기분 좋은지 아닌지
너한테 해서 시험해볼게!
German:
Okay, probieren wir es mal bei dir. Sag uns, wie
es sich anfühlt.

English: Urgh!
German: Argh!

English: Maybe a massage isn't such a good idea.
Chinese: ……放棄槌肩膀好了。
Korean: ……어깨 안마는 그만두자
German: Vielleicht ist eine Massage keine so gute Idee.

English: I think you're right.
Chinese: 嗯，我也這麼覺得……
Korean: 응, 나도 그렇게 생각해……
German: Ich glaube, du hast recht.

English:
Didn't Nokia give her friend a present before?
What was it?
Chinese:
話說之前，諾奇雅不是有送給她朋友禮物嗎？
那時候她送了什麼呀？
Korean:
그러고 보니 저번에 노키아가 친구한테 선물 주지 않았던가?
뭐 줬더라?
German:
Hat Nokia ihrem Freund schon mal was geschenkt?
Was war es?

English: Was it a watch?
Chinese: 好像是，時鐘的樣子…………
Korean: 아마 시계 아니었던가……잠깐……
German: War es eine Uhr?

English: Yeah!
Chinese: 就是那個了！
Korean: 그거다!
German: Ja!

English: Money?
Chinese: 錢？
Korean: 돈?
German: Geld?

English:
How much? About 5,000 yen? I heard Nokia say
that's a lot of money.
Chinese:
大概是多少？　差不多是五千圓嗎？
之前諾奇雅有說過，這是對學生很不友善的金額。
Korean:
그건 얼마? 5천 엔 정도?
전에 노키아가 학생한테는 쓰라린 금액이라고 그랬는데
German:
Wie viel? 5 000 Yen? Nokia hat doch mal gesagt,
das wäre viel Geld.

English: But we'd rather give her an actual thing instead.
Chinese:
但是呀，可以的話，
我們想一起送“東西”當作禮物。
Korean:
하지만 말이야, 우린 되도록
"물건"을 선물하고 싶거든
German:
Aber wir würden ihr lieber ein tatsächliches Ding
schenken.

English:
Didn't Nokia give her friend a present before?
What was it?
Chinese:
話說之前，諾奇雅不是有送給她朋友禮物嗎？
那時候她送了什麼呀？
Korean:
그러고 보니 저번에 노키아가 친구한테 선물 주지 않았던가?
그거, 뭐 줬더라?
German:
Hat Nokia ihrem Freund schon mal was geschenkt?
Was war es?

English: Was it a watch?
Chinese: 好像是，時鐘的樣子…………
Korean: 아마 시계 아니었던가……잠깐……
German: War es eine Uhr?

English: Yeah!
Chinese: 就是那個了！
Korean: 그거다!
German: Ja!

English: Accessory? What's an accessory? Is it food?
Chinese:
時鐘或飾品？
飾品是什麼？　很好吃嗎？
Korean:
시계나 액세서리?
액세서리가 뭐야? 맛있는 거야?
German:
Accessoire? Was ist ein Accessoire? Kann man das
essen?

English: Nokia told us! It's a shiny thing you wear, right?
Chinese:
諾奇雅之前有說過喔！
就是帶在身上會閃閃發光，很時尚的道具吧？
Korean:
노키아가 그랬어! 몸에 달거나 하는
반짝반짝거리고 멋진 아이템 말이지?
German:
Nokia hat uns davon erzählt! Das ist was
Glänzendes zum Anziehen, oder?

English: That's a good idea. A watch would be great.
Chinese:
雖然飾品也不錯，
亞古獸，時鐘是不是更好呢。
Korean:
액세서리도 좋지만
시계 같은 게 좋지 않을까, 아구몬
German: Das ist eine gute Idee. Eine Uhr wäre prima.

English: Hehehe, I agree! That's settled then!
Chinese:
嘿嘿嘿～我也是這麼想的！
禮物就決定是時鐘了！
Korean:
헤헤헤~ 나도 그렇게 생각해!
선물은 시계로 결정이다!
German: Hehehe, einverstanden! Das wäre geklärt!

English:
Let's get her an amazing watch! I hope she'll
like it.
Chinese:
挑一個非常時尚的時鐘吧！
如果會開心就太好了～……
Korean:
완전 멋진 시계로 하자!
기뻐해주면 좋겠다……
German:
Besorgen wir ihr eine fantastische Uhr!
Hoffentlich gefällt sie ihr.

English:
Okay, now we just need to make a watch. Come on,
Agumon!
Chinese:
那麼就只剩下準備了呢。
亞古獸，我們趕快回去吧！
Korean:
그럼 남은 건 준비뿐이네.
아구몬, 서둘러서 돌아가자!
German:
Okay, jetzt müssen wir nur eine Uhr bauen.
Komm mit, Agumon!

English: Thanks for your help! Please take this.
Chinese:
找你討論真的是找對人了，謝謝你！
這個，當作謝禮給你喔。
Korean:
너랑 상담하길 잘했어. 고마워!
이거 답례로 줄게
German: Danke für deine Hilfe! Bitte nimm das.

English: Thanks so much, [p]! See you!
Chinese:
[p]，真的很謝謝你！
那麼，下次再見喔～！
Korean:
[p], 정말 고마워!
그럼 다음에 봐~!
German: Vielen Dank, [p]! Tschüs!
